attributes.action: bring in a law to allow euthanasia for those with poor or no quality of life.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Why is it that it is legal for Vets to put down our pets and that it is being “cruel to be kind” but when it is your own flesh and blood and one of our own kind it is illegal to let someone slip away gracefully and with some dignity. 
When a pet has extremely poor quality of life a Vet will suggest putting the animal to sleep, but with humans the law states that we have to keep the person living, even sometimes against their will, when they refuse to eat or drink and where they have very little or no quality of life. Why is it that we are kinder to other species then what we are to our own. Surely this is wrong and needs to be altered.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
